Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk kmod-redhat-i40e
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: new packages: kmod-redhat-i40e, kmod-redhat-i40evf
Vulnerability.Description:
New kmod-redhat-i40e and kmod-redhat-i40evf packages are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. The kmod-redhat-i40e package contains the Intel® Ethernet Connection XL710 Network Driver kernel module, which adds official support for the new i40e devices, specifically: Intel Ethernet Controller XXV710 for 25GbE backplane Intel Ethernet Controller XXV710 for 25GbE SFP28
The new PCI IDs supported by this package are: 8086:158a Intel Corporation Ethernet Controller XXV710 for 25GbE backplane 8086:158b Intel Corporation Ethernet Controller XXV710 for 25GbE SFP28
The kmod-redhat-i40evf package contains the Intel® XL710 X710 Virtual Function Network Driver kernel module, which adds official support for virtual function of the aforementioned i40e devices.
The kernel modules delivered by this erratum have been made available as part of the Red Hat Driver Update Program, which provides updated kernel modules that add support for selected devices in advance of the next Red Hat Enterprise Linux minor update release. We strongly recommend that these kernel modules be only used when it is necessary to enable the specific hardware mentioned in this erratum. Partners and customers should continue to use the driver that is shipped in the latest Red Hat Enterprise Linux kernel for all other devices that require this driver. (BZ#1448412, BZ#1448413)
All users who require kmod-redhat-i40e or kmod-redhat-i40evf are advised to install these new packages.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
